law.catch_line: Subsequent Offenses; Breach Of Recognizance On Appeal
law.text: If a person convicted under section fifty-three appeals from the sentence, the commission of any like offence by him before judgment on the appeal shall be a breach of the condition of the recognizance, if any was taken upon allowing the appeal.
